document_data.name: Ritiik
document_data.mainbody: The '''ritiik''' was a member of the [[spear]] family of [[polearm]]s,{{Cite dragon/331/The Point of Pole Arms|26}} used in the polar regions of [[Toril]], such as the [[Great Glacier]].
document_data.Description: The weapons were made of bone and measured {{SI|6|ft|long=yes}} in length, In some lands, this weapon could sell for as much as 5 [[gold pieces]].
document_data.Weaponology: The ritiik was designed for the purpose of attacking large animals found in cold environs, such as [[polar bear]]s. Whenever the shaft of this weapon managed to pierce the flesh of a creature, the spear head would then be jerked backed so that its hook could dig into the flesh, potentially allowing for them to be dragged down to the ground.

Notable Users.Individuals:
* [[Luftuk]], an [[Iulutiun]] businessman in [[Lilinuk]], carried a ritiik that he would lightly tap upon the ground whenever he wished to emphasize a point.<ref>
* [[Najass]], a master Iulutiun hunter, carried a ritiik.
* [[Uhokkaki]], a highly regarded [[warrior]] and [[Ulutiun_dictionary#P|pimataung]] of the [[Hupiik]] tribe, carried a ritiik.<ref>
Notable Users.Races & Sentient Creatures:
* The ritiik was predominantly used in the Great Glacier by the Iulutiun people,<ref> including the [[Angulutiun]] sub-group,<ref> being a common weapon among hunting parties.
* Beyond the Iulutiuns, the weapon could be found in use by some [[neanderthal]]s.<ref>
Notable Users.Religions: * The ritiik was a common weapon of the [[priest]]s and [[specialty priest]]s of [[Ulutiu]].<ref>
